topics.body:
Well since we're on the subject anyhow(albeit sarcastically); I just read up on something interesting:  Apparently over the course of the last twenty years the number of people identify as bisexual or gay has exploded.

I was reading up on something related to psychology and I had a tvtropes moment where you spend hours clicking on links reading things and apparently recent studies into sexuality in teens has found that although twenty years ago 5% of individuals had been in a same sex relationship now 15% of individuals identify as either bisexual or homosexual.

Granted these are ballpark estimates cause even twenty years ago homosexuality was still massively vilified, but that does raise some interesting thing about society.

Don't quote me, but personally I think people are just more willing to accept their sexuality instead of how in the past it was massively vilified by society.

I guess Kinsey was right.  It's one of those cases where a controversial study into a controversial topic at the time gets constantly hammered and torn to pieces to try to discredit them, but in the end they turn out to be right.  If Kinsey was right then damn son that's going to be a lot of people in the future who identify as not heterosexual.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
